-iL <inputfilename>.Details: Specify a file containing a list of hosts or networks to scan.

-iR <num hosts>.Details: Select a specified number of random targets for scanning.

--exclude <host1[,host2][,host3],...>.Details: Exclude specific hosts or networks from the scan.

--excludefile <exclude_file>.Details: Exclude hosts or networks listed in a file from the scan.

-sL.Description: List Scan - simply list targets to scan
-sL.Details: Perform a simple listing of targets without scanning them.

-sn.Details: Perform a ping scan without attempting to discover open ports.

-Pn.Description: Treat all hosts as online -- skip host discovery
-Pn.Details: Bypass host discovery and treat all specified hosts as online.

-PS/PA/PU/PY[portlist].Description: TCP SYN, TCP ACK, UDP or SCTP discovery to given ports
-PS/PA/PU/PY[portlist].Details: Send TCP SYN,  TCP ACK,  UDP  or SCTP discovery probes to specified ports.

-PE.Description: ICMP echo, timestamp, and netmask request discovery probes
-PE.Details: Send ICMP echo,  timestamp  and netmask request discovery probes.

-PO[protocol list].Details: Send IP protocol ping probes using the specified protocols.

-n/-R.Description: Never do DNS resolution/Always resolve [default: sometimes]
-n/-R.Details: Control DNS resolution behavior during scanning.

--dns-servers <serv1[,serv2],...>.Details: Use custom DNS servers for name resolution during scanning.

--system-dns.Details: Use the operating system's default DNS resolver for name resolution.

--traceroute.Description: Trace hop path to each host
--traceroute.Details: Perform a traceroute to each scanned host to show the path taken.

-sS/sT/sA/sW/sM.Details: Perform different types of TCP scans: SYN,  Connect,  ACK,  Window,  Maimon.

-sU.Details: Perform a scan to discover open UDP ports.

-sN/sF/sX.Description: TCP Null, FIN, and Xmas scans
-sN/sF/sX.Details: Perform TCP scans with Null,  FIN  or Xmas flags set.

-sI <zombie host[.Details: Perform an idle scan using a specified zombie host and optional probe port.

-sY/sZ.Details: Perform SCTP INIT or COOKIE-ECHO scans.

-sO.Details: Perform a scan to determine which IP protocols are supported by hosts.

-b <FTP relay host>.Details: Perform an FTP bounce scan through a specified relay host.

-p <port ranges>.Details: Limit scanning to specified port ranges.

--exclude-ports <port ranges>.Description: Exclude the specified ports from scanning

-F.Description: Fast mode - Scan fewer ports than the default scan
-F.Details: Perform a faster scan by reducing the number of scanned ports.

-r.Details: Scan ports in sequential order without randomization.

--top-ports <number>.Details: Limit scanning to the specified number of most common ports.

--port-ratio <ratio>.Details: Specify a ratio to determine which ports to scan based on commonality.

-sV.Description: Probe open ports to determine service/version info
-sV.Details: Detect services and their versions on open ports.

--version-intensity <level>.Details: Control the intensity of service/version detection probes.

--version-light.Details: Limit service/version detection to probes deemed most likely.

--version-all.Details: Attempt every possible service/version detection probe.

--version-trace.Description: Show detailed version scan activity (for debugging)
--version-trace.Details: Display detailed information about service/version detection probes.

-sC.Details: Enable default NSE scripts for scripting engine scanning.

--script=<Lua scripts>.Description: <Lua scripts> is a comma separated list of
--script=<Lua scripts>.Details: Specify Lua scripts to execute during scanning.

--script-args=<n1=v1,[n2=v2,...]>.Details: Pass arguments to NSE scripts during execution.

--script-args-file=filename.Description: provide NSE script args in a file
--script-args-file=filename.Details: Specify a file containing arguments for NSE scripts.

--script-trace.Description: Show all data sent and received
--script-trace.Details: Display all data sent and received during NSE script execution.

--script-updatedb.Details: Update the NSE script database with the latest version.

--script-help=<Lua scripts>.Details: Display help information for specified Lua scripts.

-A.Description: Enable OS detection, version detection, script scanning, and traceroute
-A.Details: Enable comprehensive scanning including OS detection, version detection,  script scanning,  and traceroute functionality.

--osscan-limit.Description: Limit OS detection to promising targets
--osscan-limit.Details: Restrict OS detection to targets showing promising results.

--osscan-guess.Details: Increase aggressiveness of OS detection guessing.

-T<0-5>.Details: Select a timing template for scan speed and reliability.

--min-hostgroup/max-hostgroup <size>.Details: Control the size of parallel host scan groups.

--min-parallelism/max-parallelism <numpr.Details: Specify the number of probes to run in parallel during scanning.

--min-rtt-timeout/max-rtt-timeout/initia.Description: Specifies timeout values for round-trip time during scanning.

--max-retries <tries>.Description: Caps number of port scan probe retransmissions
--max-retries <tries>.Details: Limit the number of retransmissions for port scan probes.

--host-timeout <time>.Description: Give up on target after this long
--host-timeout <time>.Details: Specify a timeout duration after which scanning a target is aborted.

--scan-delay/--max-scan-delay <time>.Details: Set a delay between scan probes  with optional maximum delay.

--min-rate <number>.Description: Send packets no slower than <number> per second
--min-rate <number>.Details: Set a minimum rate for sending packets during scanning.

--max-rate <number>.Description: Send packets no faster than <number> per second
--max-rate <number>.Details: Set a maximum rate for sending packets during scanning.

-f; --mtu <val>.Details: Fragment packets during scanning,  optionally specifying MTU size.

-D <decoy1,decoy2[,ME],...>.Details: Conduct a scan using decoy IP addresses to hide the origin.

-S <IP_Address>.Details: Use a specified IP address as the source address for scan packets.

-e <iface>.Details: Select a specific network interface for sending scan packets.

-g/--source-port <portnum>.Details: Specify a particular source port number for scan packets.

--proxies <url1,[url2],...>.Details: Route scan connections through specified HTTP or SOCKS4 proxies.

--data <hex string>.Description: Append a custom payload to sent packets
--data <hex string>.Details: Include a custom hexadecimal payload in packets sent during scanning.

--data-string <string>.Description: Append a custom ASCII string to sent packets
--data-string <string>.Details: Append a custom ASCII string to packets sent during scanning.

--data-length <num>.Description: Append random data to sent packets
--data-length <num>.Details: Include random data in packets sent during scanning,  up to a specified length.

--ip-options <options>.Description: Send packets with specified ip options
--ip-options <options>.Details: Include specified IP options in packets sent during scanning.

--ttl <val>.Details: Set the Time-To-Live (TTL) value in IP packets sent during scanning.

--spoof-mac <mac address/prefix/vendor n.Details: Use a specified MAC address or prefix as the source MAC address for scan packets.

--badsum.Description: Send packets with a bogus TCP/UDP/SCTP checksum
--badsum.Details: Send packets with an intentionally incorrect TCP, UDP or SCTP checksum during scanning.

-oN/-oX/-oS/-oG <file>.Description:
Output scan in normal, XML, s|<rIpt kIddi3,Output scan results in one or more formats: normal, XML, s|<rIpt kIddi3,
-oA <basename>,Output in the three major formats at once,Generate output in all major formats: normal, XML, and s|<rIpt kIddi3,
-v,Increase verbosity level (use -vv or more for greater effect),Increase verbosity level to show more detailed scan information.
-d,Increase debugging level (use -dd or more for greater effect),Increase debugging level to provide extensive debug information.
--reason,Display the reason a port is in a particular state,Show the reason why a port is in a specific state during scanning.
--open,Only show open (or possibly open) ports,Display only open or possibly open ports in scan results.
--packet-trace,Show all packets sent and received,Log and display all packets sent and received during scanning.
--iflist,Print host interfaces and routes (for debugging),Print information about host interfaces and routes for debugging purposes.
--append-output,Append to rather than clobber specified output files,Append scan results to specified output files instead of overwriting them.
--resume <filename>,Resume an aborted scan,Resume a previously interrupted scan using a specified resume file.
--noninteractive,Disable runtime interactions via keyboard,Disable interactive prompts and interactions during scanning.
--stylesheet <path/URL>,XSL stylesheet to transform XML output to HTML,Use an XSL stylesheet to convert XML scan output into HTML format.
--webxml,Reference stylesheet from Nmap.Org for more portable XML,Reference Nmap.Org's stylesheet for more portable XML scan output.
--no-stylesheet,Prevent associating of XSL stylesheet w/XML output,Disable association of any XSL stylesheet with XML scan output.
-6,Enable IPv6 scanning,Enable scanning of IPv6 addresses and networks.
-A,Enable OS detection
-oN/-oX/-oS/-oG <file>.Details: version detection,  script scanning,  and traceroute, Enable comprehensive scanning including OS detection  version detection  script scanning  and traceroute functionality.

--datadir <dirname>.Description: Specify custom Nmap data file location
--datadir <dirname>.Details: Set a custom directory location for Nmap data files.

--send-eth/--send-ip.Description: Send using raw ethernet frames or IP packets
--send-eth/--send-ip.Details: Choose to send packets using raw Ethernet frames or IP packets.

--privileged.Description: Assume that the user is fully privileged
--privileged.Details: Assume full privileges for scan operations (requires root/administrator access).

--unprivileged.Description: Assume the user lacks raw socket privileges
--unprivileged.Details: Assume limited privileges for scan operations.

-V.Details: Display the current version number of Nmap.

-h.Details: Display a summary of available Nmap command-line options.

--interactive.Details: Enable interactive mode for user input and interaction.

--insecure.Details: Disable SSL/TLS certificate validation for HTTPS-based services.

--cert <certfile>.Details: Use a specified SSL certificate for SSL/TLS connections.

--key <keyfile>.Details: Use a specified SSL key for SSL/TLS connections.

--cipher <cipherlist>.Details: Specify a list of SSL ciphers for SSL/TLS connections.

--http-useragent <agent>.Description: Set the User-Agent for HTTP requests
--http-useragent <agent>.Details: Specify a custom User-Agent header for HTTP requests.

--http-referer <url>.Description: Set the Referer for HTTP requests
--http-referer <url>.Details: Specify a custom Referer header for HTTP requests.

--http-method <method>.Description: Set the HTTP method to use
--http-method <method>.Details: Specify the HTTP method (GET,  POST,  etc.) for HTTP requests.

--http-host <host>.Description: Set the Host header for HTTP requests
--http-host <host>.Details: Specify the Host header for HTTP requests.

--http-cookie <cookie>.Description: Set the Cookie header for HTTP requests
--http-cookie <cookie>.Details: Specify the Cookie header for HTTP requests.

--http-auth <type>.Description: Set the HTTP authentication type (basic, digest,  ntlm)
--http-auth <type>.Details: Specify the type of HTTP authentication (basic,  digest,  NTLM).

--sslcert <certfile>.Details: Use the specified SSL certificate for SSL/TLS connections.

--sslkey <keyfile>.Details: Use the specified SSL key for SSL/TLS connections.

--sslciphers <cipherlist>.Description: Specify the SSL ciphers to use
--sslciphers <cipherlist>.Details: Specify a list of SSL ciphers for SSL/TLS connections.

--sslproto <protocol>.Description: Specify the SSL protocol to use (TLSv1.2,  TLSv1.3)
--sslproto <protocol>.Details: Specify the SSL/TLS protocol version to use (e.g.  TLSv1.2,  TLSv1.3).

--proxy <url>.Description: Relay connections through a proxy server
--proxy <url>.Details: Route connections through a specified HTTP or SOCKS4 proxy server.

--proxy-auth <username:password>.Details: Provide credentials for proxy server authentication (username:password).

--user-agent <agent>.Details: Specify a custom User-Agent header for HTTP requests.

--referer <url>.Details: Specify a custom Referer header for HTTP requests.

--custom-header <header:value>.Details: Specify a custom HTTP header in the format "header:value".

--follow-redirects.Details: Automatically follow HTTP redirects during scanning.

--max-redirects <num>.Description: Specify the maximum number of redirects to follow
--max-redirects <num>.Details: Limit the number of HTTP redirects to follow during scanning.

--timeout <time>.Details: Specify the timeout duration for establishing connections.

--connect-timeout <time>.Description: Set the timeout for establishing connections
--connect-timeout <time>.Details: Specify the timeout duration for establishing connections.

--retry <num>.Description: Set the number of retries for failed connections
--retry <num>.Details: Specify the number of retries for failed connections.

--retry-delay <time>.Details: Specify the delay duration between retry attempts for failed connections.

--retry-backoff <factor>.Description: Set the backoff factor for retries
--retry-backoff <factor>.Details: Specify the backoff factor for exponential backoff retries.

--retry-jitter <time>.Details: Specify the jitter amount for introducing randomness in retry delays.

--retry-on <statuscodes>.Description: Retry on specified HTTP status codes
--retry-on <statuscodes>.Details: Specify HTTP status codes on which to retry failed connections.

--disable-keepalive.Details: Disable HTTP keep-alive connections during scanning.

--disable-http2.Details: Disable HTTP/2 protocol support for HTTP requests.

--http2-prior-knowledge.Details: Start using HTTP/2 protocol immediately without upgrading from HTTP/1.1.

--http2-settings <settings>.Details: Specify custom settings for HTTP/2 protocol.

--http2-disable-push.Details: Disable support for HTTP/2 server push for HTTP requests.

--http2-window-size <size>.Details: Specify the initial HTTP/2 window size for flow control.

--http2-headers-table-size <size>.Description: Set the maximum HTTP/2 headers table size
--http2-headers-table-size <size>.Details: Specify the maximum size of the HTTP/2 headers table for compression.

--http2-max-concurrent-streams <num>.Description: Set the maximum number of concurrent streams
--http2-max-concurrent-streams <num>.Details: Specify the maximum number of HTTP/2 concurrent streams to allow.

--http2-max-frame-size <size>.Description: Set the maximum HTTP/2 frame size
--http2-max-frame-size <size>.Details: Specify the maximum size of HTTP/2 frames.

--http2-max-header-list-size <size>.Description: Set the maximum HTTP/2 header list size
--http2-max-header-list-size <size>.Details: Specify the maximum size of HTTP/2 header lists.

--http2-initial-window-size <size>.Description: Set the initial HTTP/2 window size
--http2-initial-window-size <size>.Details: Specify the initial window size for HTTP/2 connections.

--http2-max-header-table-size <size>.Description: Set the maximum HTTP/2 header table size
--http2-max-header-table-size <size>.Details: Specify the maximum size of the HTTP/2 header compression table.

--http2-enable-push.Details: Enable support for HTTP/2 server push for HTTP requests.

-6.Details: Enable scanning of IPv6 addresses and networks.
